metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1878 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the cmd_submitf function in cgi/cmd.c in Nagios Core, possibly 4.0.3rc1 and earlier, and Icinga before 1.8.6, 1.9 before 1.9.5, and 1.10 before 1.10.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (segmentation fault) via a long message to cmd.cgi.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1878` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

icinga - 1.10.3
icinga-cgi - 1.10.3
icinga-cgi-bin - 1.10.3
icinga-common - 1.10.3
icinga-core - 1.10.3
icinga-idoutils - 1.10.3
No subscription required

nagios3 - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-cgi - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-common - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
nagios3-core - 3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: icinga package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.3').
nagios3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.1.dfsg-2.1ubuntu1.1').
